Description: Red pottery ostracon, from the body of a vessel, interior grooved, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of seven lines of demotic text in black ink and one of Greek beneath.
Curator's comments: This ostracon yields a so-called r-rḫ=w ("that which was measured") text. These texts, all originating from the Thebaid in the Ptolemaic and early-Roman period, were issued to farmers after a measurement of their cultivated land had been conducted in order to determine due amounts of harvest tax. (Information provided by Gert Baetens, KULeuven) Bibliography: Kaplony-Heckel, U., Theben-West und Theben-Ost (31 demotische r-rḫ=w Ostraka aus dem British Museum), in: Israeli-Groll, S. (ed.), Studies in Egyptology, presented to Miriam Lichtheim. Jerusalem, 1990 I, 606-607 (no. 27). Kaplony-Heckel, U., 2009, Land und Leute am Nil nach demotischen Inschriften, Papyri und Ostraca, Gesammelte Schriften Teil 1, Harrassowitz Verlag; Wiesbaden, pp.493. On the text genre, see: For r-rḫ=w texts, cf. Vandorpe K., 'The Ptolemaic Epigraphe or Harvest tax (shemu)', in Archiv für Papyrusforschung 46 (2000), p. 165-228. Kaplony-Heckel U., Thebanische Acker-Amt-Quittungen, in Allam, S., Grund und Boden in Altägypten (rechtliche und sozio-ökonomische Verhältnisse): Akten des internationalen Symposions Tübingen 18.-20. Juni 1990 (Untersuchungen zum Rechtsleben im alten Ägypten; Band 2) Tübingen, 1994, pp. 189-197.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (97100) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/97100)
